articles.title: Spotlight: US COVID-19 cases top 1 mln, true number of infections likely "much higher" - Xinhua | English.news.cn - Xinhua
articles.content: A man wearing a face mask walks on the Times Square in New York, the United States, on April 27, 2020. The number of COVID-19 cases in the United States topped 1 million Tuesday afternoon, reaching 1,002,498 as of 1:55 p.m. (1755 GMT), according to the Center… [+6000 chars]

articles.author: Daniel Bateman
articles.title: Expert warns about Palmer's COVID-19 'best hope' - Balonne Beacon
articles.description: An infectious disease expert has warned about Clive Palmer’s plan to “cure” Australia of coronavirus.
articles.content:
AN infectious disease expert has warned that Clive Palmer's plan to "cure" Australia of coronavirus may use a dangerous choice of treatment.
The Queensland mining billionaire published a full-page advertisement in the Cairns Post yesterday claiming his Palme… [+1892 chars]

articles.author: CNN
articles.title: Pictured: ‘Hero’ New York doctor who took her own life after fighting on COVID frontline - 7NEWS.com.au
articles.description: ‘She went down in the trenches and was killed by the enemy on the front line’.
articles.content:
A New York City emergency room doctor who took her own life after recovering from Covid-19 and continuing to treat coronavirus patients has been pictured.
Dr. Lorna Breen, 49, died a hero, said her father, Philip Breen.
Watch the video above

articles.title: Wuhan lab virus leak fears raised in early February - Ballina Shire Advocate
articles.description: Advice to the Morrison government as early as February suggested that COVID-19 may have been an inadvertent leak from a Wuhan laboratory.
articles.content:
Advice to the Morrison government as early as February suggested that COVID-19 may have been an inadvertent leak from a Wuhan laboratory, three senior federal sources have confirmed.

articles.title: 6-month-old girl gets guard of honor from hospital staff after beating COVID-19 - GMA
articles.description: A 6-month-old girl got a guard of honor from health care workers at Alder Hey Children’s Hospital after defeating COVID-19 following an open-heart surgery.
